column4: I'm interested why commands noted in man pages, such as, " apt_preferences(5)" have the bracketed-numbered prefix appended to them.
It's like watching an Matrix operators screen in this chat room... Get a user limit.

man pages have sections, for example (1) is a command, (5) is a configuration file. If for some silly reason a command and a config file have the same name, you can specify with man 5 <name> to get the config file
